wikipedia_page.main: Charles Twysden Hoare (10 November 1851 – 22 January 1935) was an English first-class cricketer active 1871–78 who played for Middlesex and Surrey. He was born in Mitcham; died in Bicester.

response: *Charles Hoare (cricketer, born 1847) (1847–1908), English cricketer and banker
*Charles Hoare (priest) (1781–1865), evangelical Church of England clergyman, archdeacon of Surrey
*Charles Hoare (banker) (1767–1851), senior partner of C. Hoare & Co

response: * James Wadsworth Ritchie (1861–1924), who married Emily Montague Tooker, a daughter of Gabriel Mead Tooker, in 1895. After her death in 1903 he married Daisy Muriel Hoare, a daughter of Charles Hoare, in 1907.
